channel.title: Grafana Office Hours on Nicole van der Hoeven
channel.description: Recent content in Grafana Office Hours on Nicole van der Hoeven

item.title: How to Get Started with Tempo (Grafana Office Hours #22)
item.description:
Grafana Labs Principal Engineer and Tempo maintainer Joe Elliot talks about how to get started with Tempo, what distributed tracing is, and why TraceQL is cool. He is joined by Developer Advocates Nicole van der Hoeven and Paul Balogh.

Resources

  • Getting started with Tempo (video)
  • Grafana Tempo repo
  • Grafana Tempo docs
  • The Tempo category on the Grafana community forum
  • Video playlist for Grafana Tempo
  • Distributed tracing with Grafana Cloud k6 (Grafana Office Hours video)

item.title: How to Use Flow Mode for Grafana Agent (Grafana Office Hours #21)
item.description:
Senior Software Engineer Matt Durham shows us how to use flow mode for Grafana Agent. Flow mode is a new and better way to install and configure Grafana Agent than the older “static mode”. Among other things, flow mode’s modularity makes it easier to build more complex workflows like traditional data pipelines and allows for more use cases than collecting and processing telemetry.

Resources

  • Grafana Agent repo
  • Grafana Agent docs
  • Grafana Agent flow mode
  • What is Grafana Agent? (previous Grafana Office Hours video)
  • Grafana Slack - there’s an #agent channel
  • Grafana Agent Community Call agenda
  • Modules for Grafana Agent

item.title: Realistic Tests with Testcontainers (Grafana Office Hours #20)
item.description:
In this episode of Grafana Office Hours, we talk about realistic unit tests utilizing actual instances of databases and other dependencies. We’ll be joined by Manuel de la Peña from AtomicJar, and Pablo Chacin from Grafana to learn how we can use the Testcontainers open-source framework to create lightweight, throwaway dependencies for our tests.

Related links

  • Testcontainers
  • k3s Module
  • k6 Module

item.title: Load Testing on Kubernetes with k6 Private Load Zones (Grafana Office Hours #19)
item.description:
This week, we’re talking about how you can do load testing on Kubernetes with k6 Private Load Zones, a new feature on Grafana Cloud k6 that leverages the k6 Kubernetes operator to allow you to run distributed load tests against applications behind a firewall. Here to discuss this new feature are Senior Software Engineer Olha Yevtushenko, Product Manager Daniel González Lopes, Developer Advocate Paul Balogh, and Senior Developer Advocate Nicole van der Hoeven.

Related links

  • The Grafana k6 repo
  • k6 operator repo
  • Docs on Private Load Zones in Grafana Cloud k6

item.title: Combining Frontend and Backend Performance (Grafana Office Hours #18)
item.description:
In this episode of Grafana Office Hours, Developer Advocates Marie Cruz and Nicole van der Hoeven speak with John Hill, a Web UI Test Engineer and Grafana k6 champion, to talk about how the Grafana and k6 ecosystems can be used to ensure performance in mission-critical applications like NASA’s Open MCT.

Useful links

  • Open e2e Testing Initiative
  • Open MCT performance Github project

item.title: Real user monitoring with Grafana Faro (Grafana Office Hours #17)
item.description:
Have you heard of Grafana Faro and how it can help in providing insights into your real user experience? Developer Advocates Nicole van der Hoeven and Marie Cruz chat with Software Engineers Kostas Pelelis and Marco Schaefer to discuss what Grafana Faro is, why it’s important to have a real user monitoring solution, and how to get started with Grafana Faro.

Useful links

  • Frontend observability docs
  • Grafana Faro repo

item.title: What Is Grafana Agent? (Grafana Office Hours #16)
item.description:
What is Grafana Agent? Senior Software Engineer Paschalis Tsilias tells us about what telemetry collectors do, why they’re useful, what you’d have to do without them, and how to get started with Grafana Agent.

Useful links

  • Grafana Agent repo
  • Documentation on Grafana Agent

item.title: Agentless Monitoring for Grafana Cloud (Grafana Office Hours #15)
item.description:
Did you know you could do agentless monitoring for Prometheus in Grafana Cloud? Senior Software Engineer Matt Nolf talks about the new Metrics Endpoint integration and how you can use it to collect Prometheus metrics from publicly addressable hosts– WITHOUT using Grafana Agent.

Links

  • Docs on Metrics Endpoint
  • Blog post on Metrics Endpoint

item.title: Distributed tracing with Grafana Cloud k6 (Grafana Office Hours #14)
item.description: My friend Marie Cruz and I interview Senior Software Engineer Łukasz Gut about a new feature: Distributed Tracing with Grafana Cloud k6. He discusses what distributed tracing is, why it matters, and how it can help teams find reliability issues faster.

item.title: How to Deploy Grafana on Kubernetes (Grafana Office Hours #13)
item.description:
My coworker Usman Ahmad and I talk about how to deploy Grafana on Kubernetes for beginners: what Kubernetes is, how it’s an evolution of distributed computing, what its relationship to Docker is, other things you might need to know to work with Kubernetes, and how you can deploy Grafana on your own Kubernetes clusters.

Documentation on how to deploy Grafana on Kubernetes here.

item.title: Modernizing government documents with Govable and Grafana (Grafana Office Hours #12)
item.description: Ari Hershowitz and Andrii Kovalov from Govable.ai talk about modernizing government documents with Govable and Grafana, and how they saved weeks of effort by using Grafana as a ready-made frontend for their clients. They are joined by Developer Advocates Nicole van der Hoeven and Paul Balogh from Grafana Labs.

item.title: Grafana k6 for WebSockets and infrastructure testing (Grafana Office Hours #11)
item.description: In this episode of Grafana Office Hours, Solution Architect Huzaifa Asif talks about how he has used Grafana k6 for WebSockets and infrastructure testing, and how k6 can be used for general reliability testing in addition to load testing. He is joined by Grafana Labs Developer Advocates Nicole van der Hoeven and Paul Balogh.

item.title: How to learn Grafana with Grafana Play (Grafana Office Hours #10)
item.description: If you were wondering how to learn Grafana, Grafana Play is probably the easiest way. Grafana Play is a collection of ready-made dashboards and apps that you can use without creating an account. Developer Advocates Matt Abrams, Paul Balogh, and Nicole van der Hoeven discuss how to take advantage of this awesome tool and what you can do with it.

item.title: Getting started with Grafana Loki (Grafana Office Hours #09)
item.description: Senior Principal Solutions Engineer Ward Bekker talks about getting started with Grafana Loki: what Loki is, why you need log aggregation, and how it fits into the rest of the Grafana stack. He is joined by Developer Advocates Paul Balogh and Nicole van der Hoeven to tell you everything you need to know about Loki.

item.title: Observing the Internet of Things (Grafana Office Hours #08)
item.description: My colleague Paul Balogh and I welcomed Daniel Mangum, Lead Cloud Engineer from Golioth. We learned how Golioth uses Grafana to report data from varied sensors and monitors.

item.title: How to get started with Grafana and Docker (Grafana Office Hours #07)
item.description:
My colleague Usman Ahmad and I talk about how to use Docker to quickly get up and running with Grafana, how to add Grafana plugins, and how to troubleshoot common issues.

Grafana documentation on how to install Grafana on Docker here.

item.title: OpenTelemetry demo app with Grafana, Tempo, Loki, and Prometheus (Grafana Office Hours #06)
item.description: DevOps Engineer Blueswen Liu 劉義瑋 joins us to walk us through some OpenTelemetry demo apps he created, instrumented with Grafana, Loki, Prometheus, and Tempo.

item.title: Distributed tracing for testing with Grafana Tempo and Tracetest (Grafana Office Hours #05)
item.description: In this video, my colleague Paul Balogh and I welcomed Daniel Mangum, Lead Cloud Engineer from Golioth. We learn how Golioth uses Grafana to report data from varied sensors and monitors.

item.title: Monitor behind a Firewall With Private Data Source Connect (Grafana Office Hours #04)
item.description: How do you monitor behind a firewall? With Grafana Cloud Private Data Connect, you can create a secure tunnel to query data sources, even including those in VPCs on public cloud vendors. Senior Software Engineers Stephanie Hingtgen and Georges Chaudy talk to me about how it works.

item.title: Changes to Grafana Plugins in Grafana 10 (Grafana Office Hours #03)
item.description: Grafana 10 is fresh off the presses, and it includes some important changes to Grafana plugins that any plugin developer or user will want to know. Senior Product Manager David Harris chats to me about all the new features available to plugins (including the new Scenes framework) and some breaking changes to legacy plugins.

item.title: What's New in Grafana 10? (Grafana Office Hours #01)
item.description: What’s new in Grafana 10? I interview Grafana Labs Product Director Mitch Seaman about all the new features in Grafana 10, including Scenes, correlations, some important plugin development changes, and improved security.

item.title: What Is Grafana Scenes? with Torkel Ödegaard (Grafana Office Hours #03)
item.description: In GrafanaCON 2023, the latest version of Grafana 10 was announced, and with it, Scenes. But what is Grafana Scenes? Torkel Ödegaard, creator of Grafana and co-founder of Grafana Labs, joined me to discuss what Scenes is and how you can use it to create dynamic dashboards like never before.
